course_description: Basic grammar; acquisition of fundamental reading, writing, oral expression and comprehension skills.
Grammar study; development of reading, writing, oral expression and comprehension skills.
prerequisites: Notes: Students must submit an official high school trans cript to the instructor as proof of their level of competence in order to receive Departmental confirmation of registration before the end of the second week of classes (see Undergraduate Academic Calendar). Failure to do so will result in de-registration from the course. This course consists of 2hrs in-person and 1hr onl ine-asynchronous. This course has an experiential learning component . students with 4U/M French or equivalent may not take this course. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Grammar review; literary, cultural and journalistic readings; practice in reading, writing, oral expression and comprehension.
prerequisites: Notes: This course will also include an additional 1.5hrs online/asynchronous time. This course has an experiential learning component . students must obtain a minimum 65 percent in FREN 1F90 in order to enroll in Year 2 French courses. Not open to Francophones (first language is French and attended a Francophone school) who obtained a minimum of 75 percent in Grade 12 French. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Grammar review and practice at the French III Level.

course_description: Literature from 1800 to the present in its cultural contexts. Works from different genres, historical periods and cultural traditions. Dissertation, technical vocabulary, rhetorical terminology and interpretative concepts.
prerequisites: Corequisites: Corequisite(s): FREN 2F00.

course_description: Literature from 1800 to the present in its cultural contexts. Works from different genres, historical periods and cultural traditions. Dissertation, technical vocabulary, rhetorical terminology and interpretative concepts.
prerequisites: Corequisites: Corequisite(s): FREN 2F00.

course_name: Intro to the Linguistic Study of French
course_description: Basic concepts of linguistics through analysis of contemporary French as it is spoken and written throughout the francophone world. Topics may include phonetics, phonology, morphology, lexicology, syntax and semantics.
prerequisites: Notes: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_name: Children’s Lit in Fren:picture Book & Beyond
course_description: Selection of texts representative of a variety of genres, including the picture book, fairytale, short story and novel emphasizing the contemporary period. Theory of children's literature. Picture books from France and other francophone regions; theory of the picture book and its use in the classroom.
prerequisites: Corequisites: Corequisite(s): FREN 2F00.

course_description: Ideological, historical and cultural aspects of Francophone societies. Topics may include colonialism, issues in language, literature, the arts and gender.
prerequisites: Corequisites: Corequisite(s): FREN 2F00.

course_description: Sound patterns of French. Articulatory, auditory and acoustic properties of human speech. Phonemic and non-phonemic (stress, intonation, rhythm) features.
prerequisites: Notes: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Art, music, architecture and aesthetics to 1800; intellectual trends; history, politics and society.
prerequisites: Corequisites: Corequisite(s): FREN 2F00.

course_description: Advanced grammar and stylistics of contemporary French. Applications to composition.
prerequisites: Corequisites: Corequisite(s): FREN 2F00.

course_description: Development of oral and written skills for use of French in business transactions and communications. Developing business vocabulary, focusing on correspondence formulae and terminology.
prerequisites: Notes: This course consists of 2hrs in-person and 1hr onl ine-asynchronous. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Lexicon (vocabulary), fluency, style, listening skills, comprehension and production.
prerequisites: Notes: This course consists of 1hr45mins in-person and 1h r15mins online asynchronous time. multimedia tools will be used. Not open to Francophones (first language is French and attended a Francophone school) who obtained a minimum of 75 percent in Grade 12 French. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Lexicon (vocabulary), fluency, style, listening skills, comprehension and production.
prerequisites: Notes: This course consists of 1hr45mins in-person and 1h r15mins online asynchronous time. This course has an experiential learning component . multimedia tools will be used. Not open to Francophones (first language is French and attended a Francophone school) who obtained a minimum of 75 percent in Grade 12 French. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Baroque, Classicism and Siècle des Lumières. Authors may include Corneille, Molière, Racine, Mme de La Fayette, Montesquieu, Marivaux, Voltaire and Rousseau.
prerequisites: Exclusions: Completion of this course will replace previous assigned grade and credit obtained in FREN 3P81, 3P82, 3P91 and 3P92.

course_description: Ideological and aesthetic perspectives. Texts chosen from various genres. Authors may include Proust, Gide, Claudel, Apollinaire, Breton.
prerequisites: Notes: This course consists of 2hrs in-person and 1hr onl ine-asynchronous. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: French-language literary works of the Caribbean. Historical, cultural, ideological and theoretical concerns. Authors may include Maryse Condé. René Depestre, Patrick Chamoiseau.
prerequisites: Exclusions: Completion of this course will replace previous assigned grade and credit obtained in FREN 3P84.

course_description: Background and traditions; analysis of selected plays and study of current directions.
prerequisites: Exclusions: Completion of this course will replace previous assigned grade and credit obtained in FREN 3P89.

course_description: Syntax and semantics of French; theoretical applications to textual analysis of literary genres.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): FREN 2F03, 3P03 and one-half credit (taught in French) in literature numbered 3(alpha)00 or above.

course_description: Lexical, morphological, syntactic and semantic interrelationships between source text and target text; application of translation methodologies to a variety of texts.
prerequisites: Notes: This course consists of 2hrs in-person and 1hr onl ine-asynchronous. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Internship in a business where French is used. May include health care, tourism, translation, community services and business.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): FREN 3P03 and 3P05.

course_description: Texts from various genres representing major aesthetic movements.
prerequisites: Notes: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Beur phenomenon in France via novels and film. Historical, cultural, ideological and theoretical concerns. Authors may include Azouz Begag, Nina Bouraoui, Mehdi Charef, Soraya Nini and Leïla Sebbar.
prerequisites: Notes: This course consists of 2hrs in-person and 1hr onl ine-asynchronous. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Notes: This course consists of 1.5hrs in-person, and 1.5h rs online/asynchronous time. This course has an experiential learning component .
prerequisites: Notes: This course consists of 2hrs in-person and 1hr onl ine-asynchronous. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
